document_data.name: Council of Four
document_data.mainbody:
The '''Council of Four''', whose individual members were referred to as the '''Dukes''' in the mid–14{{th}} and 15<sup>th</sup> century [[DR]],
{{Quote|Ambition has a price in Baldur's Gate, and it is paid to the Council.|Anonymous{{Cite MTG|CLB|271|{{MTGc|The Council of Four||CLB|#=271}}|[[Justine Cruz]]}}}}
document_data.History:
The history of the council dates back to the earliest days of Baldur's Gate and the conflict between the rich farmers of the walled city and the sea-captains of the harbor who refused to pay for entering the gate that had been financed by their colleague [[Balduran]]. The captains overthrew the farmers and the four eldest among them were installed as rulers, jokingly calling themselves "dukes".

In the mid–15{{th}} century DR, Grand Duke [[Valarken]] tried to seize power using [[lycanthrope]] mercenaries, but failed. After that, surviving Duke [[Dillard Portyr]] dissolved the council, which was replaced by the [[Parliament of Peers|Baldurian Parliament]] for some time.

In [[1492 DR]], the Council of Four and the Parliament of Peers were dissolved after [[Enver Gortash|Lord Enver Gortash]] was named the first archduke of Baldur's Gate following a vote in the High Hall by the peers.
